Events that occurred on 4 December.

content.title: On Earth
content.content:
1944 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 91b.
1947 - Essays Presented to Charles Williams, including "On Fairy-Stories", is published.
1953 - An issue of the magazine Radio Times featuring an article by J.R.R. Tolkien, is published.
1955 - The fourth episode of 1955 radio series of The Fellowship of the Ring airs on the BBC Third Programme.
1963 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to a Miss Clark.
1967 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to Roger Verhulst.
1999 - Voice actress Gaia Wise is born.
2001 - The documentary Master of the Rings is released.
2004 - The Lord of the Rings Symphony plays in Newark, New Jersey.
2012 - Guardians of Middle-earth is released on PlayStation 3 and Xbox 360.
2014 - JRR Tolkien, le seigneur des Ã©crivains (La Grande Librairie) is aired.

content.title: In Arda
content.content:
T.A. 3018:
Frodo and Samwise rest in Rivendell and prepare for their quest to destroy the One Ring.
